content.text:
# Allium kingdonii

Allium kingdonii is a rare species of wild onion endemic to southeastern Tibet. It grows at elevations of 4500–5000 m.[http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=2&taxon_id=200027494 Flora of China v 24 p 177.  钟花韭 zhong hua jiu Allium kingdonii]
Allium kingdonii generally produces one narrow cylindrical bulb rarely more than 6 mm across. Scape is up to 30 cm tall. Leaves are flat, narrow, shorter than the scape. Umbels have a few reddish-purple flowers.
